ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Vicki
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: What a girl!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Angela
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: What a girl!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Elizabeth
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Let's put on a show!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Sir

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Barry
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Francisco! That's fun to say! Francisco... Frannncisco... Franciscooo…
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Buddy the Elf and Max

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Max
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Francisco! That's fun to say! Francisco... Frannncisco... Franciscooo…
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Buddy the Elf and Max

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Mam
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Ju-dath!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Kate
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You were hatched.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Kate

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Michael
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Excuse me sir, where do you keep your nuts?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Michael

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Abby
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: The night that Paddy Murphy died, I never will forget. The Irish all got Stinking drunk, and some aren't sober yet. The one thing that they did that night that filled my heart with fear, they took the ice right off the corpse and put it on the beer! Oh, that's how we showed our respect for Paddy Murphy, that's how we showed our honor and our pride. Oh, baby! That's how we showed our respect to Paddy Murphy, on the night that Paddy died!

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Adelynn
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Biggie girl, no tiny baby.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Sir
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Woooooooo. Pig. Sooie! Woooooooo. Pig. Sooie! Woooooooo. Pig. Sooie! Razorbacks!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Arkansas Hog Call

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Maridith
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Yes, Law.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Claire
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Eat this fruit. Do you want to die of the scurvy?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Rachel
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: My darlink!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Rob
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Chuck, meet Buck.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Barry

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Cathy
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Mama loved her baby girl.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Emily
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: She is too clever by half.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Ben
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Put another candle on the birthday CAKE, the birthday CAKE, the birthday CAKE. Put another candle on the birthday CAKE, you're another year older today. Boop boop.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Cathy

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Carl
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I have a case of the conkus of the bonkus.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Carl

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Papa
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: CHAIRS! (a toast)
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Mary Shelley
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Mary Shelley (author of Frankenstein) was born August 30, 1797

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Matt A
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Never go to a doctor whose office plants have died.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Erma Bombeck

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Justin
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Ya done good.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Matt G
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Too soon old, too late smart.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Jack
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Pull my string! The birthday party's today.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Woody Pride from Toy Story

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Becky
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: It's Beauteous!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Laura
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I did not have three thousand pairs of shoes, I had one thousand and sixty.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Imelda Marcos

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Jenny
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Good night, nurse.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Mike P
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Kah-Rahm-Bah!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Virginia
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: She was like a house afire.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Granny our Matriarch
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: She’s a biddy, but she's a tough old biddy.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Granny and Papa
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Marry in haste, repent at leisure.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Barry and Becky
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Marry in haste, repent at leisure.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Carl and Cathy
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: She was all over him like a cheap suit.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Matt and Kate
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: For better or worse, but not for lunch.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Judith and Marcus
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Doesn’t get much better than that.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Vicki and Mike
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: It’s just as easy to love a rich man as it is to love a poor man.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Dr Seuss
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter and those who matter don't mind.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Dr. Seuss

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: iPod
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I think that music faded in importance for a while, and the iPod has helped to bring music back into people's lives in a really meaningful way. I think music is good for the soul.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Steve Jobs

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Mickey Mouse
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: When people laugh at Mickey Mouse, it's because he's so human; and that is the secret of his popularity.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Walt Disney

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: New Year’s Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Cheers to a new year and another chance for us to get it right.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Oprah Winfrey

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Leap Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Just keep swimming … swimming … swimming …
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Dory from the movie Finding Nemo

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Daylight Savings Time Begins (Turn clock forward an hour)
Daylight Savings Time Ends (turn clock back an hour)
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Daylight savings ends first Sunday in November

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: First day of Spring
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Spring is nature's way of saying, "Let's party!"
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Robin Williams

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: First day of Summer
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: It's a smile, it's a kiss, it's a sip of wine … it's summertime!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Kenny Chesney

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: First day of Autumn
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Give me juicy autumnal fruit, ripe and red from the orchard.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Walt Whitman

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: First day of Winter
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: A lot of people like snow. I find it to be an unnecessary freezing of water.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Carl Reiner

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Total Solar Eclipse
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: So I was just about to, you know, walk on by. When suddenly, and without warning, There was this ... Total eclipse of the sun.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Da Doo from Little Shop of Horrors

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Shrove Tuesday
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Drama is very important in life: You have to come on with a bang. You never want to go out with a whimper. Everything can have drama if it's done right. Even a pancake.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Julia Child

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Ash Wednesday. First day of Lent.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Those have a short Lent who owe money to be paid at Easter.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Benjamin Franklin

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Palm Sunday
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Palm Sunday is like a glimpse of Easter. It's a little bit joyful after being sombre during Lent.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Laura Gale

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Good Friday
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: The dripping blood our only drink, The bloody flesh our only food: In spite of which we like to think That we are sound, substantial flesh and blood-- Again, in spite of that, we call this Friday good.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: T.S. Eliot

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Easter
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: 2,000 years ago Jesus was crucified. Three days later he walks out of a cave. And now they celebrate with chocolate bunnies and marshmallow peeps, and beautifully decorated eggs. I guess these were things Jesus loved as a child.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Billy Crystal

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Ascension
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Ascensions into heaven are like falling leaves sad and happy all at the same time Going away isn't really sad especially when your going enables a new kind of presence to be born.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Earnest Hemingway

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: All Saints' Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Winter is an etching, spring a watercolor, summer an oil painting and autumn a mosaic of them all.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Stanley Horowitz

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: All Saints' Day (Methodist)
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Winter is an etching, spring a watercolor, summer an oil painting and autumn a mosaic of them all.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Stanley Horowitz
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Methodists celebrate on the first Sunday in November

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: All Souls' Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: As long as we remember those who have passed away, as long as we tell their stories, sing their songs, tell their jokes, cook their favorite meals, THEN they are with us, around us, and in our hearts.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Jorge R. Gutierrez

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Christmas Eve
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: The best way to spread Christmas cheer is singing loud for all to hear.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Buddy the Elf

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Christmas Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: One of the most glorious messes in the world is the mess created in the living room on Christmas Day. Don't clean it up too quickly.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Andy Rooney

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SPECIAL: ISLAMIC HOLIDAYS DO NOT WORK CORRECTLY YET. The date changes based on location and my calculations currrently are not consistent with published dates through 2020 even for North America

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Inauguration Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: But every difference of opinion is not a difference of principle.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Thomas Jefferson
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Every 4 years after a national election

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Martin Luther King Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I have a dream that one day this nation will rise up and live out the true meaning of its creed: We hold these truths to be self-evident: that all men are created equal. I have a dream that one day on the red hills of Georgia the sons of former slaves and the sons of former slave owners will be able to sit down together at a table of brotherhood.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Martin Luther King
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Martin Luthor King Day is third Monday of January

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Groundhog Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Phil: What would you do if you were stuck in one place and every day was exactly the same, and nothing that you did mattered? Ralph: That about sums it up for me.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Phil and Ralph from the movie Groundhog Day

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Valentine's Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Valentine's Day is so much fun, sending cards to everyone. Big red Hearts so bright and gay. I love you, I love you. That's what they say!

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Presidents' Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: The pay is good and I can walk to work.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: John F. Kennedy
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: President's Day is third Monday of February (can occur Feb 15 - 21 inclusive)

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: April Fools' Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I have great faith in fools -- self-confidence, my friends call it.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Edgar Allan Poe

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Tax Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: If you get up early, work late, and pay your taxes, you will get ahead — if you strike oil.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: J. Paul Getty

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Earth Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Wine is constant proof that God loves us and loves to see us happy.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Benjamin Franklin

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Administrative Professionals Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: TODO: Last full week of April. Don't support that yet so using 4th week. This works for next few years.

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: May Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: With the coming of spring, I am calm again.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Gustav Mahler

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Memorial Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Those who have long enjoyed such privileges as we enjoy forget in time that men have died to win them.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Franklin D. Roosevelt
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Last Monday in May

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Mother's Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: God could not be everywhere, and therefore he made mothers.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Rudyard Kipling
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Mother's Day: Second Sunday in May

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Armed Forces Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I can't find a person without some link to the armed forces
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Robyn Carr
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Armed Forces Day is the third Sunday in May

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: D Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Rangers, Lead the Way!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Colonel Francis W. Dawson
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Left blank so Cathy's birthday quote appears.

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Flag Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I believe our flag is more than just cloth and ink. It is a universally recognized symbol that stands for liberty, and freedom.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Senator John Thune

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Father's Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Dad tought me everything I know. Unfortunately, he didn't teach me everything he knows.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Al Unser

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: 4th of July
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You'll shoot your eye out.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Santa Claus (and others) from the movie A Christmas Story

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Labor Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: If all the cars in the United States were placed end to end, it would probably be Labor Day Weekend.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Doug Larson

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Patriot Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Patriotism is not short, frenzied outbursts of emotion, but the tranquil and steady dedication of a lifetime.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Adlai Stevenson

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Columbus Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Columbus Day is second Monday in October

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Native American Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: One does not sell the land people walk on.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Crazy Horse
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Columbus Day is second Monday in October

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Halloween
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Trick or treat. Smell my feet. Give me something good to eat.

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Veterans Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Courage in danger is half the battle.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Plautus

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Election Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Every election is determined by the people who show up.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Larry J. Sabato

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Thanksgiving
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Gobble, gobble, gobble, fat turkeys, fat turkeys. Gobble, gobble, gobble, fat turkeys are we. We're not here for living, we're here for Thanksgiving. Gobble, gobble, gobble, fat turkeys are we.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Johnny Burke
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Fourth Thursday in November

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Black Friday
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Fourth Friday in November (day after Thanksgiving)

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Pearl Harbor Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Praise the lord and pass the ammunition.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Lt. Howell Forgy

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: National Religious Freedom Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Religion is like a pair of shoes.....Find one that fits for you, but don't make me wear your shoes.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: George Carlin

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Read Across America Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You're never too old, too wacky, too wild, to pick up a book and read to a child.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Dr. Seuss

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: National Anthem Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I'm a Caribbean Amphibian. I like to hop in the tropical … sea.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Kermit the Frog

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Arbor Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: He who plants a tree plants a hope.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Lucy Larcom

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: National Former Prisoner of War Recognition Day
National Ellis Island Family History Day
National Nurses Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: My memory of you is better than you.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Lao Tzu

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: World Red Cross Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You can't go wrong with the Red Cross. I know it's boring. But they're there, and they are ready."
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Trent Stamp

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Military Spouses Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Military spouses day is two days before Mother's Day

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Teacher Appreciation Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Tuesday of the first full week in May

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: National Maritime Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Those who live by the sea can hardly form a single thought of which the sea would not be part.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Hermann Broch

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Moon Day (Man Walks on the Moon)
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: That's one small step for a man, one giant leap for mankind.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Neil Armstrong on July 20, 1969

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Parents Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Parent's Day is the fourth Sunday in July

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Sisters Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Sister's day is the first Sunday in August

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: US Coast Guard Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: The Blue Book says we've got to go out and it doesn't say a damn thing about having to come back.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Captain Patrick Ethridge

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Senior Citizens Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Listen to me, mister. You're my knight in shining armor. Don't you forget it. You're going to get back on that horse, and I'm going to be right behind you, holding on tight, and away we're gonna go, go, go!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Ethel Thayer from the movie On Golden Pond

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Women's Equality Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Oh, sweetheart, you don't need law school. Law school is for people who are boring and ugly and serious. And you, button, are none of those things.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Elle Wood's Father from the movie Legally Blonde

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: World Teacher's Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Fire Prevention Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Only you can prevent forest fires.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Smokey the Bear

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Rosa Parks Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I would like to be remembered as a person who wanted to be free… so other people would also be free.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Rosa Parks

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Chinese New Year. Year of the Fire Chicken.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You will have a prosperous year … in bed.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Chinese Proverb

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Chinese New Year. Year of the Earth Dog.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You will have a prosperous year … in bed.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Chinese Proverb

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Chinese New Year. Year of the Earth Pig.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You will have a prosperous year … in bed.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Chinese Proverb

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Chinese New Year. Year of the Metal Rat.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You will have a prosperous year … in bed.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Chinese Proverb

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Chinese New Year. Year of the Metal Ox.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Those Hamm/Flemmings can turn a phrase.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Elizabeth Donovan

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: St. Patrick's Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: The night that Paddy Murphy died, I never will forget. The Irish all got Stinking drunk, and some aren't sober yet. The one thing that they did that night that filled my heart with fear, they took the ice right off the corpse and put it on the beer! Oh, that's how we showed our respect for Paddy Murphy, that's how we showed our honor and our pride. Oh, baby! That's how we showed our respect to Paddy Murphy, on the night that Paddy died!

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Cinco De Mayo
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Margot: You're going to need this. Elle: Your scrunchie? Margot: My LUCKY scrunchie. It helped me pass Spanish class. Serena: You passed Spanish because you gave Professor Montoya a lap dance after the final. Margot: Yeahhhhh, luckily!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: The movie Legally Blonde

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Canada Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: It's never felt more Canadian to be Canadian than it does now.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Douglas Coupland

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: National Clean Off Your Desk Day
Festival of Sleep Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I love sleep. My life has a tendency to fall apart when I'm awake, you know?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Ernest Hemingway

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Penguin Awareness Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I can see Russia from my house.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Tina Fey as Sarah Palin

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Data Privacy Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Privacy is not something that I'm merely entitled to, it's an absolute prerequisite.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Marlon Brando

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Spay and Neuter Your Pet Day
Umbrella day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Let a smile be your umbrella, and you'll end up with a face full of rain.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: George Carlin

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Do a Grouch a Favor Day
Be Humble day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: What? Like, it's hard?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Elle Woods from the movie Legally Blonde

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Pi Approximation Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: There aren't enough small numbers to meet the many demands made of them.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Richard K. Guy

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Everything You Think Is Wrong Day
Everything You Do Is Right Day
National Goof Off Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Along with voting, jury duty, and paying taxes, goofing off is one of the central obligations of American citizenship.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Sarah Vowell

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: National "Joe" Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: My boyfriend is Italian and from New Jersey, so naturally he was thrilled to meet Joe Pesci.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Diablo Cody

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: National Peanut Butter and Jelly Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: When I'm in the mood for room service, my favorite order is a peanut-butter-and-jelly sandwich.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Pharrell Williams

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Weed Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: When they put me in jail, that's when they turned me into an activist. Up until the time I went to jail, I was just a comedian.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Tommy Chong

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Great Poetry Reading Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Genuine poetry can communicate before it is understood.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: T.S. Elliot

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Star Wars Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: May the force be with you.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Obi Wan Kenobi

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Limerick Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: To start giving this house a spring clean. I will do it I say, Yes, I'll do it today, Well, I'll do it tomorrow, I mean

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Towel Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: A towel is about the most massively useful thing an interstellar hitchhiker can have.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: The Hitchhiker's Guide to te Galaxy

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: National Take Your Dog To Work Day
National Handshake Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Last Thursday in June

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: National Leave the Office Early Day
Flip a Coin Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Flip a coin. When it's in the air, you'll know which side you're hoping for.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Arnold Rothstein

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: National Corn on the Cob Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Sex is good, but not as good as fresh sweet corn.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Garrison Keillor

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Cow Appreciation Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Chik-Fil-A

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: National Bikini Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Honest to goodness it's the absolute ultimate!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Gidget

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Chocolate Day (disputed)
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: National Chocolate day is reported as July 7, October 28 and December 28 in various sources.

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: International Bacon Day (not to be confused with National Bacon Day)
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Bippity boppity bacon!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Jim Gaffigan

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Kids Take Over the Kitchen Day
National Play-Doh Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Rita (or Becky): This day was perfect. You couldn't have planned a day like this. Phil (or Barry): Well, you can. It just takes an awful lot of work.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Groundhog day

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: National Homemade Cookie Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: This feels like déjà vu all over again.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Yogi Berra

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Boss's Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You have that sharp, useless look about you.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Vivian Ward from the movie Pretty Woman
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Actually not fixed. Rule is "if it falls on a weekend, it is the closest day. This isn't a rule I've implemented. Closest is WeekdayOnOrAfter

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Swallows Depart from San Juan Capistrano Day
Chocolate Day (disputed)
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: National Chocolate day is reported as July 7, October 28 and December 28 in various sources.

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: National Knock-Knock Jokes Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Knock Knock. Who's There? Orange. Orange Who? Orange you glad it's Halloween?

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Men Make Dinner Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: THAT just happened!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Ricky Bobby from the movie Talledega Nights
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Men Make Dinner Day is the first Thursday in November

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: National Adoption Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Saturday before Thanksgiving

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Pretend to Be a Time Traveler Day
Answer the Telephone Like Buddy the Elf Day
Festivus
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Welcome, new comers. The tradition of Festivus begins with the airing of grievances.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Frank Costanza from Seinfeld

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: National Fruitcake Day
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You know you are getting old when the candles cost more than the cake.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Bob Hope

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Chocolate Day (disputed)
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: National Chocolate day is reported as July 7, October 28 and December 28 in various sources.

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: National Bacon Day (not to be confused with International Bacon Day)
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Bippity boppity bacon!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Jim Gaffigan

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Super Bowl Sunday
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: Super Bowl is first Sunday in February

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Wizard of Oz released (1939)
ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Toto, I've a feeling we're not in Kansas anymore.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Dorothy Gale

ns1:PAGE.ns1:NAME: Rockefeller Christmas Tree Lighting
ns1:PAGE.ns1:COMMENT: First Wednesday after Thanksgiving

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Fasten your seatbelts. It's going to be a bumpy night.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Bette Davis

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: There's no place like home.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Dorothy Gale from the movie The Wizard of Oz

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: It's proud I am.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I’m going to thrash you!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Mercy!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Flemming Family Frase

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Don’t forget to bring in your brass monkey.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You have a little Don Ho on you.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Barry

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Brrrry brr!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Put the arm on me for…
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Oh, that's fit for a king. Here King!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: More's the pity.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I miss it like a toothache.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: The writing's on the wall.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: That’s my story and I’m sticking with it.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Oh kids, this is going to be such an adventure.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Always wave at every helicopter you see.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Barry

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Where are you at? Just before the at?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You are so dumb. You are really dumb -- for real.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Antoine Dodson

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You look fine.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Sir

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: This is one time where television really fails to capture the true excitement of a large squirrel predicting the weather.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Phil from the movie Groundhog Day

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: They say I have ADD but they just don't understand. Oh, look, a chicken!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Barry

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You drive like Pu-Ling.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I wouldn’t be a bit surprised.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Go wash your hands and face and don’t touch a thing on the way.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: A little song. A little dance. A little seltzer down your pants.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Chuckles the Clown from The Mary Tyler Moore Show

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Would you please put on some pants? I feel weird having to ask you twice.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Phil from the movie The Hangover

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: It's cheap, easy and close to home.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: It's better than a poke in the eye with a sharp stick.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: God save the queen.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Angela

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Do you want a spotch upside the head?
Oh my God, the bend and snap works every time.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Legally Blonde

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You're sassy, classy and kickin'-assy.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: A Hallmark greeting

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: They fixed enough food to feed an army of coxes.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: War does not determine who is right, only who is left.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Bertrand Russell

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: They’d kick if they were in swimming.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: The best thing to hold onto in life, is each other.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Audrey Hepburn

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Roger. Zero-G and I feel fine. Capsule is turning around. Oh! That view is tremendous!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: John Glenn from Friendship 7

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Everyone just pretend to be normal.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Richard from the movie Little Miss Sunshine

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Take your time a’going and don’t hurry back!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Quitter's quit.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Benjamin

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I could just eat her up with a spoon.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Heavens to Murgatroyd.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Snagglepuss

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Do you remember when we spent those four amazing hours in the hot tub together? Well, this is so much better than that!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Elle Woods from the movie Legally Blonde

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: “Beave!” said the mother. “We beave” said the seven…
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You always appear more formidable to others than you think you are.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: David Zeke

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Consistency is the last refuge of the unimaginative.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Oscar Wilde

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: He was pretty good…for him.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Be good and if you can’t be good be careful.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: If it's not one thing, it's the other and sometimes it's both.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I’ll just say this about that.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Bucky was plucky, but he kept right on going.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Later than I ever knowed it to be.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Little Bead, Patter Rogue, Dolly Hossle, Tinkle Whistle, Great Big Hobble Gobble.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: It's all about everything.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: If they're Irish, invite them over for a drink and a fist fight.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Cathy

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Ah it's marvelous, it tis. How we look so much alike.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Chester O'Chimp

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Use the Force, Luke.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Obi Wan Kenobi

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Kitties, kitties everywhere. Kitties, kitties in my hair.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: How did Abby take a picture of her eyelashes?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Maridith

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Peas, peas, peas, eating goober peas!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Cathy

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Where's the beef?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Clara Peller from a Wendy's commercial

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: No, that’s what YOU get!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You ain’t a whistlin’.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: May the light always find you on a dreary day. When you need to be home, may you find your way. May you always have courage to take a chance and never find frogs in your underpants.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Irish Proverb

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You’ll get your reward in heaven… a bale of hay, you jackass!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Crack kills.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Becky

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Where am I going? Crazy. Want to come?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Vicki

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: They all died in a freak gasoline fight accident.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Derek Zoolander

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: They were a motley crew.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Have you ever killed anyone? Yeah, but they were all bad.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Arnold Schwarzenegger from True Lies

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Hussy!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Any girl can be glamorous. All you have to do is stand still and look stupid.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Hedy Lamarr

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: April hath put a spirit of youth in everything
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: William Shakespeare

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Republicans believe every day is the Forth of July, but the democrats believe every day is April 15th.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Ronald Reagan

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Elections should be held on April 16th -- the day after we pay our income taxes. That is one of the few things that might discourage politicians from being big spenders.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Thomas Sowell

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Can you hear me now?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I never said most of the things I said.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Yogi Berra

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I'll be there God willing and if the creek don’t rise.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Sharkbait OO HA HA.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Bloat, Gurgle and Bubbles from the movie Finding Nemo

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: What in the Ho-Hum?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Holy crap on a hot cross bun!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Cathy

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: She's a lean green tooth-eating machine.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Maxwell (about Abby)

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Live long and prosper.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Mr. Spock from Star Trek

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: He doesn’t know diddly.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: He doesn't have a snowball’s chance in Hell.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Can't we all just get along?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Rodney King

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You had me at hello.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Dorothy Boyd from the movie Jerry McGuire

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I need that like a dose of salts.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: That’s neither here nor there.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You kill your snakes and I'll kill mine.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Cathy

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: If you're not yet divorced, you're neither fish nor fowl.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: What's new in this neck of the woods?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Efforts don't count. Results do.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: David Zeke

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Here, let me connect those freckles.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: MoMam (to Rachel)

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Are you crying? Are you crying? ARE YOU CRYING? There's no crying! THERE'S NO CRYING IN BASEBALL!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Jimmy Dugan from the movie A League of Their Own

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: What are you doing? Everyone I can and the easy ones twice!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: What happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas. Except herpes. That stuff'll come back with you.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: The Hangover

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: That was the pause that refreshed.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: If that's what you think, you’ve got another think a’comin’.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Cause we were like, woaaaah… and I was like, woaaah… and you were like, woaaah…
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Crush from the movie Finding Nemo

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Hey, guys! I know a shortcut…
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Any FunFam Member

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Doesn't that just rip the rag?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Go drink a bottle of yourself.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Mary Catherine Gallagher from the movie Superstar

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Daaaaaaad!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Abigail

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Go out in a blaze of glory.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You're a bean brain.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Whoa Nelly.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I'm just saying…
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Kate

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: He was as sore as a boil.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I should know this. My uncle's a painter.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Mac from the movie Little Big League

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Never wear anything that panics the cat.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: P. J. O'Rourke

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Les Averman: Just so you know, we really suck. Gordon Bombay: Hey, I'll decide who sucks around here.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Les Averman and Gordon Bombay from the movie The Mighty Ducks

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: …that's what she said (after any -- ANY sentence).
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Matt G

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: God gave us our faces, but we pick our own noses.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Remember kid, there's heroes and there's legends. Heroes get remembered but legends never die. Follow your heart kid and you'll never go wrong.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: The Babe from the movie The Sandlot

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: We're a couple of puzzle pieces.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Maridith

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: School's out, school's out. Teacher let the monkey's out.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: MoMam

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I shall call him Squishy and he shall be mine and he shall be my Squishy. Come on, Squishy. Come on, little Squishy.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Dory from the movie Finding Nemo

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: It's not all skittles and beer, you know.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Un-Nerved or Un-TOWARD.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Doubtless God could have made a better berry than the strawberry, doubtless God did.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Don't do anything I wouldn't do and that doesn't leave much!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Fruit? Good. Cake? GREAT! Fruitcake? … Nasty crap.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Jim Gaffigan

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I'd do it for 10 cents and a pickle.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: What makes you think I'm a lawyer?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Edward Lewis from the movie Pretty Woman

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Thank you and goodnight.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Walter Cronkite

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: No gentlemen callers are allowed upstairs.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: MoMam

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Idahooo, it's noisy in Boise.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Rachel

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Come a cropper.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: He's suffering from the meepus mopus.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I'm taking a vacation from my problems.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Bob Wiley from the movie What About Bob

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: See saw, Marjorie Daw.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Whatever major looser (W-M-L).
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Matt G

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Show me the money!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Rod Tidwell from the movie Jerry McGuire

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: He doesn't have a chance in Hades.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: She's as ugly as a mud fence.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Better than a jab in the ass with a dull pitchfork.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I suggest a new strategy, R2. Let the wookie win.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Han Solo

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: It just shows to go ya!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: No decision is a decision in itself.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Sir

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Don't get your panties in a knot.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Rachel

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Be good, sweet maid, and let those who will be clever.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Gran often refers to one's smalls, that is, their lingerie.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Going on a trip? I must Lux out my undies.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Wow! I wish I could speak whale…
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Dory from Finding Nemo

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Fine, I'll meet you in the lobby, but only 'cuz you're payin' me to.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Vivian Ward from the movie Pretty Woman

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: California is a fine place to live -- if you happen to be an orange.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Fred Allen

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Life is a chair of bowlies.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Mary Engelbreit

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: She has a case of nervous prostitution.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Who ate the bread?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: MoMam

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Matt, Mickey Mouse is at the door for you.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Becky

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Where in the Sam Hill did I put my purse?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Don't that make your blue eyes brown.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: We are pals! Best of Pals! DoDoDoDoDoDoDo! We are the best of pals!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You're killing me Smalls!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Ham Porter from the movie The Sandlot

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Betty please… Betty please pickup… Please don't harass Betty, please.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Laverne DeFazio

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: It was hotter than the hubs of Hell.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You're a blaggard.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Did you all take Stupid Pills this morning?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Mr. Potato Head from the movie Toy Story

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Lewis: I tell any girl I'm going out with to assume that all plans are soft until she receives confirmation from me thirty minutes beforehand. Robin: And they find this romantic? Lewis: Well, I say it with a great deal of charm.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Lewis and Robin from the movie The American President

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Blabber Becky
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: MoMam

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I'll need some kinda riggin' to secure this.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Wax on … wax off. Wax on … wax off.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Mr. Miyagi from the movie The Karate Kid

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Cuter than a bunny's ear.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Cathy

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Phil: I'm a god. Rita: You're God? Phil: I'm a god. I'm not THE God… I don't think.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Phil and Rita from the movie Groundhog Day

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Circumstances alter cases.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: MoMam

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: She has a face that could stop an eight day clock.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Oh, that's a cute zoot suit.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: White coral bells, upon a slender star, Lilies of the valley deck my garden walk.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Vicki

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You probably get this a lot. This isn't the real Caesar's Palace is it?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Alan Garner from the movie The Hangover

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Do your ears hang low? Do they wobble to and fro? Can you tie them in a knot? Can you tie them in a bow? Can you swing them over your shoulder like a continental soldier? Do your ears hang low?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Cathy

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Well, this is one mell of a hess!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Ted Striker: Surely you can't be serious! Rumack: I am serious… and don't call me Shirley.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Ted Striker and Rumack from the movie Airplane!

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Cow hoof.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I'm Mom's favorite!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Any FunFam Child

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I have a case of the family complaint.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I should hope to shout!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I'm the king of the world!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Titanic

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Damned if you do, damned if you don’t.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: So, when you said you'd be open until 5, you were lying?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Barry

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: This place sucks.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Benjamin

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: A skunk sat on a stump. The stump thunk the skunk stunk. The skunk thunk the stump stunk. What stunk- the skunk or the stump?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Barry: We can either see the Berlin Wall or visit the Hummel factory? Becky: No contest -- Hummel factory.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Becky

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Do we need to go to the ladies room?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: MoMam

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Help me Tom Cruise.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Ricky Bobby from the movie Talledega Nights

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Ugly bugly.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: He was trouble from the git go.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Curse you, Aqua Scum.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Gurgle from the movie Finding Nemo

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: He's a numb nuts.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: That’s besides the point.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I was bedazzled at birth.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Emily

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Ride like the wind, Bullseye.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Woody Pride from Toy Story

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: A word to the wise ain't necessary -- it's the stupid ones that need the advice.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Bill Cosby

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: That's neither here nor there.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: He's ornerier than homemade sin.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: If the gays get the rainbow, I get the sun.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: MoMam

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Are you agin' or fer me?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Do you feel lucky? Well, do ya, punk?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Harry Callahan from the movie Dirty Harry

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: He's tighter than a tick.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Yes sir, Mr. Ducksworth. Thank you very much, Mr. Ducksworth. Quack, quack, quack, Mr. Ducksworth!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Gordon Bombay from the movie The Mighty Ducks

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Oh my God, they killed Kenny! …You bastards!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Stan from the TV show South Park

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Beckaaaaa…. Beckaaaaa…. SMACK... Whaaaaa!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Maridith

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You Peepot!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: The children of lovers are orphans.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: MoMam

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Don't let the beard fool you. He's a child.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Stu Price from the movie The Hangover

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Lavender blue dilly dilly, lavender's green. When I am king dilly dilly, you shall be queen.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Vicki

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You know, if I had your job, I'd kill myself. Wait here, I'll see if I can dig up a pistol.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Ernie Capadino from the movie A League of Their Own

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Perhaps I didn't properly explain the fundamentals of the slowdown plan.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Andrew Shepherd from the movie The American President

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Frankly, my dear, I don't give a damn.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Rhett Butler from the movie Gone with the Wind

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I'm Chester O'Chimp. Doodley, doodely, doodely dum.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Chester O'Chimp

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Popular? I know about popular.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Glinda

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Girlies!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I'll have what she's having.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Estelle Reiner in the movie When Harry Met Sally

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: A child of five would understand this. Send someone to fetch a child of five.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Groucho Marx

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Pug nosed pilot pugging down the pugway.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Vicki

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: See, how it works is, the train moves, not the station!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Ernie Capadino

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I have ESPN.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Benjamin

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I knew she was scrappy.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Maridith

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Jack London

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: He's mean as a snake.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Fun Family
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: MoMam

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: We’re terribly lost, but making good time.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You are the bane of my existence.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Mama always said life was like a box of chocolates. You never know what you're gonna get.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Forest Gump

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I would if I could, but I can't, so I won't.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Sir

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: That's no moon. It's a space station.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Obi Wan Kenobi

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You like me. You really like me!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Sally Field (misquoted)

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Ramsey residence, Maridith speaking.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Sir

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Duke put me in time out.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Abigail

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: He’s mean, but he’s fair -- he’s mean to everyone.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Glinda: I've decided to make you my new project. Elphaba: You really don't have to do that. Glinda: I know. That's what makes me so nice!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: The play Wicked

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Share what you love, Honor what you consume, Give away what you can, And embrace those who inspire you.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Katherine Cerulean

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You work on commission right? Big mistake. Big. HUGE!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Vivian Ward

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I once caught a fish T-H-I-S big.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Dave

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Hang your clothes on a hickory stick, but don’t go near the water.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: We are going to be spending an obscene amount of money in here. So we're going to need a lot more help sucking up to us, 'cause that's what we really like.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Edward Lewis from the movie Pretty Woman

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: He's nuts, totally around the bend.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Tickle fight!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Buddy the Elf

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Grazie…or Yahtzee!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Maridith

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: She was as nervous as a whore in church on Sunday.

ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: You kids call THAT a drunken brawl?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: The older the berry, the sweeter the juice.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: MoMam

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I can do that in jig time.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: There has got to be more to life than just being really, really, really ridiculously good-looking.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Derek Zoolander

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Up, Hema!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Sir

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I'd buy that for a dollar.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Barry

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Here's your hat; what's your hurry?
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Bazinga!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Sheldon Cooper from the TV show The Big Bang Theory

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: I'm getting the black look.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Papa

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: He's crooked as a barrel of snakes.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: What in the ho hum!
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Granny

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: That wasn’t a choir, that was a little musical aggravation.

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Weather forecast for tonight: dark.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: George Carlin

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: Pretty is as pretty does.
ns1:PAGE.ns1:AUTHOR: Cathy

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: He took over like Grant went through Richmond.

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: There seams to be more girl than dress.

ns1:PAGE.ns1:SAYING: This page has nothing to say
